FixICE.org is a Burlington, MA-based grassroots organization dedicated to empowering you to help stop ICE cruelties, support immigrant rights, and do both by winning elections. We provide a curated list of websites and web pages to help you get involved or make your current involvement more effective. If you want to find an organization to join, the organization list is comprised of well established organizations that meet on a regular basis, make it easy to find what you need, and have a track record of effective action. The Strategy drop down categorizes resources for protests, volunteering, advocacy, or learning.

In the future, the website will categorize by effort (quick, recurring, significant effort, and one time) and provide the most critical current initiative from the organizations listed.

FixICE.org emphasizes protests at the ICDE detention center in Burlington. Protests occur Monday through Saturday at the ICE detention center in Burlington, MA. FixICE.org organizes the Monday and Tuesday protests from 11–1. Other groups organize Wednesday–Saturday protests. FixICE.org organizes the Monday and Tuesday protests. Each group brings a different perspective, which strengthens the movement.

If you’re looking for step-by-step guidance on how to get involved or start something new, the Choose Democracy website is a promising resource.

You don’t need to do everything.

You just need a place to start.

If you have any questions, contact us at info@fixice.org. We will reply by email and can set up a phone call if requested.

Note: This site will be updated regularly with new resources and information. You don't have to keep checking every page—just visit Latest Updates for a log of all recent changes and additions.
